intro: Osbeckia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored willow herb, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, paired leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Osbeckia bicolor is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks.
